name: Big Data Tools
description:
With this plugin, you can conveniently work with Zeppelin notebooks,, monitor Spark and Hadoop applications, and preview AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Minio, Linode, Digital Open Space, Microsoft Azure, and Hadoop Distributed File System files right from IntelliJ-based IDEs including IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate, PyCharm Professional, and DataGrip.


For Zeppelin notebooks written in Scala, the plugin offers smart navigation, code completion, inspections & quick-fixes, and refactorings inside the notebooks. You can browse, create, and run Zeppelin notebooks without leaving the IDE. If your Zeppelin server is using a Spark cluster, or you configured a Spark cluster separately in the plugin settings, the plugin will allow you to track Spark jobs, see cluster environment and storage information from the IDE. With ZTools, you can view details of the variables as you execute your notebooks, and can get smart completion for data frame columns in SQL and Scala.


You can also upload, download, and preview large structured files in tabular form, including CVS, Parquet, AVRO, and ORC formats.
notes:
Changes in EAP 10

Features:

  • Port forwarding with SSH tunnels
    BDIDE-1063
  • Filters and limits in the Applications tab of the Spark Monitoring tool window
    BDIDE-1077
  • User-defined dependencies
    BDIDE-1087

Bugs fixed:

  • When cells were collapsed, the cell title disappeared. Now, the cells display correctly, but you still cannot edit them with the Big Data Tools plugin. This is a subject for future fixes
    BDIDE-1078
  • Removing a Spark Monitoring connection from a Hadoop connection resulted in `IncorrectOperationException`
    BDIDE-1137
  • In the Jobs table of the Spark Monitoring tool window, the highlighted tasks could occasionally lose their selection;
    BDIDE-570
  • When updating a job tree in the Spark Monitoring tool window, the selected job could lose its selection
    BDIDE-706
  • You had to restart the IDE to obtain information about the Spark applications after you woke your computer from the sleep mode
    BDIDE-737
  • Restarting the IDE might throw `DisposalException`
    BDIDE-1049
  • Restarting the IDE with a "Variable View" open could result in `IllegalArgumentException`
    BDIDE-1060
  • Editing any properties of an inactive Spark Monitoring connection occasionally enabled it in the panel
    BDIDE-1066
  • Deleting a Zeppelin connection resulted in a `ConcurrentModificationException`
    BDIDE-1091
  • "Refresh" button might not update jobs in the Spark Monitoring tool window
    BDIDE-1092
  • After restarting Spark, the Spark Monitoring tool window displayed a connection error
    BDIDE-1093
  • It was not possible to resize error connection windows in Spark Monitoring
    BDIDE-1094
  • In Spark Monitoring, SQL tab might display an "Empty List" message instead of “Loading”
    BDIDE-1099
  • Spark Monitoring displayed SQL properties even though the connection was dropped, or the interpreter was restarted
    BDIDE-1119
  • An IndexOutOfBoundsException error occured after filtering out all applications in the Spark Monitoring tool window
    BDIDE-1130
  • Charts displayed only a single range of data whereas multiple ranges were specified in the table properties
    BDIDE-1133
  • After establishing a connection to some Zeppelin instances, a sync error was displayed. This issue is fixed now. As a part of the same ticket, we introduce Zeppelin 0.9 support, a new collaborative mode
    BDIDE-406
  • A connection error was displayed on the Detail page when there was no selection in the Application or Job tabs of the Spark Monitoring tool window
    BDIDE-746
  • In case of switching between some connection to Spark Monitoring, information about this connection might not be displayed
    BDIDE-769
  • The task list in the Spark Monitoring tool window occasionally disappeared, and an incorrect filtering message was displayed instead
    BDIDE-893
  • After launching a cell, the "Ready" status was displayed for a long time
    BDIDE-1010
  • Local notebooks in Zeppelin used to have reconnection problems
    BDIDE-1013
  • As a result of a combination of several factors, SQL code formatting might get broken
    BDIDE-1020
  • An intermediate execution output for cells was not displayed, now this output is displayed below the cells
    BDIDE-1023
  • Non-empty files on HDFS were displayed as empty and could be accidentally saved and erased
    BDIDE-1041
  • Fixed a bug in displaying SQL jobs. Previously, it was unclear if the Spark server is a History Server or not
    BDIDE-1061
  • A link to a job in Spark may be occasionally lost and reappeared again
    BDIDE-1068
  • The Big Data Tools panel did not display Hadoop and Spark connection errors
    BDIDE-1072
  • If at least one task with a progress indicator was running when closing the IDE, a "Memory leak detected" error occurred
    BDIDE-1083
  • Charts internationalization
    BDIDE-1089
  • If a connection to Zeppelin was suddenly lost, the disconnection warning was not displayed
    BDIDE-1103
  • Horizontal scroll bars in Zeppelin inlays overlapped text
    BDIDE-1104
  • `RuntimeExceptionWithAttachments` occurred if Spark Monitoring connection was lost
    BDIDE-1120
  • Restarting any interpreter resulted in a `KotlinNullPointerException`
    BDIDE-1122
  • Hadoop connection could not use SOCKS proxy
    BDIDE-1124
